title: $938 000 funding for St Mary’s

pars: St Mary’s School has received funding for upgrades to learning spaces thanks to the Victorian Government’s Non-Government Schools Capital Fund.
St Mary’s leadership, school board and staff have worked together with Mr Peter Byrne of A3 Architects to upgrade their Master plan.
“This funding will allow us to refurbish our north wing with state of the art facilities,” said Principal Mrs Cate Fraser.
Student toilets, meeting rooms and administration storage space will also be upgraded.
Mrs Fraser said this is exciting news for St Mary’s School Community. They look forward to much needed improvements to the school buildings and learning spaces.
She believes the refurbishments will contribute to maintaining their excellent reputation for quality teaching and learning in a calm environment.
“It will provide a contemporary learning environment to support our students to flourish in their learning and growth,” Mrs Fraser added.

St Mary’s School has been providing quality Catholic primary education to students and families in the Rushworth, Stanhope and Colbinabbin region for 66 years and these funds will ensure that this continues for many more years.

abstract:
St Mary’s School has received funding for upgrades to learning spaces thanks to the
Victorian Government’s Non-Government Schools Capital Fund.
